greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Coefficients of a recursive polynomial based on Chaitin's S expressions: a(0)=1; a(1)=x; a(2)=1; a(n)=vector(a(n-1)).reverse(a(n-1)).
comment: The result is an alternative way to expand s expressions as a binary rooted tree recursion.
reference: G. J. Chaitin, Algorithmic Information Theory, Cambridge Press, 1987, page 169
formula: Let b(0) = b(2) = 1, b(1) = x, and b(n) = Sum_{i=1..n} b(i-1) * b(n-i) if n>2. Then T(n, k) = coefficient of x^k in b(n) where 0 <= k <= (n+1)/2.
G.f. A(x,y) sastisfies A(x,y) = 1 - x * (1 - x - y + 2*x*y) + x * A(x,y)^2. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 09 2012
Row sums are A025262 if offset 0.
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = if( 2*k-1  > n, 0, polcoeff( polcoeff( ( 1 - sqrt( (1 - 2*x)^2 - 4*x^2 * (x + y - 2*x*y) + x^2*O(x^n))) / (2*x), n), k))} /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 09 2012 */
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Apr 24 2010
